title: Job’s Reply: My Suffering Is Great
summary: Job responds to Eliphaz, expressing how immense his suffering feels. He defends his grief and criticizes his friends for lacking compassion. Job longs for relief or death rather than hollow counsel.

faq.question: How does Job describe his suffering?
faq.answer: As heavier than the sand of the seas—beyond what his friends understand.

faq.question: What does Job say about his friends?
faq.answer: That they are like a dried-up stream—unreliable and disappointing.
